name: Great White Shark
quickFacts: Sharks don't actually like how humans taste! When they bite, it's usually a case of mistaken identity - oops!
Sharks are like ocean doctors - they keep fish families healthy by catching sick or weak fish.
Here's a twist: sharks are more scared of us! Humans catch way more sharks than sharks ever bite humans.
howTheyHelp: They keep the ocean balanced by being the top predator - without them, too many fish would eat all the coral!
Sharks have been around since before the dinosaurs. They're living fossils!

myths.fact: Nope! Sharks think surfers look like seals from below. Once they realize their mistake, they swim away super fast!

myths.myth: Getting rid of sharks makes swimming safer.
myths.fact: Actually, we need sharks! Without them, the whole ocean gets out of whack. Learning about sharks keeps us safer than fear does!

funFact: A shark can smell a single drop of blood in an Olympic-sized swimming pool!

name: Little Brown Bat
quickFacts: Less than 1 in 100 bats carry rabies - and they stay far away from people anyway!
One tiny bat can gobble up 1,000 mosquitoes in just ONE hour. Bug zappers wish they were this good!
Without bats, we wouldn't have bananas, mangoes, or chocolate! They help plants grow.
howTheyHelp: Bats are nature's pest control - they eat tons of bugs that would otherwise munch on our crops!
They're amazing pollinators! Many plants only bloom at night, and bats help them make seeds.

myths.fact: Super rare! Most bats are totally healthy. Just don't pick up any wild animals and you'll be fine!
Mind = blown! Bats are actually more closely related to US (humans) than to mice!

funFact: Bats are the ONLY mammals that can truly fly. Flying squirrels just glide - bats are the real deal!

name: Gray Wolf
quickFacts: Wild wolves are super shy around people - they'd rather run away than say hi!
Wolves are amazing parents! The whole pack helps raise the pups together.
A wolf's howl can be heard from 10 miles away. That's like howling from one end of town to the other!
howTheyHelp: Wolves keep deer and elk moving, which lets trees and plants grow back. They literally reshape forests!
When wolves hunt, they leave leftovers that feed eagles, ravens, and even bears. Sharing is caring!

myths.myth: Wolves attack people all the time.
myths.fact: In real life, wolf attacks on humans are super, super rare. Wolves are way more scared of you!

myths.myth: Wolves destroy all the farm animals.
myths.fact: Weather and sickness actually cause way more problems for farmers than wolves ever do.

funFact: Wolves can run up to 40 miles per hour - that's faster than the fastest human on Earth!

sources.title: National Park Service — Wolves and Ecosystems

name: Turkey Vulture
quickFacts: Vultures have super-powered stomachs! They can eat stuff that would make any other animal sick.
They're nature's cleanup crew - without them, the world would be way stinkier and germier!
Vultures can soar for hours without flapping their wings. Talk about energy-efficient!
howTheyHelp: They clean up dead animals before germs can spread. Vultures are basically nature's sanitation workers!
By eating things other animals can't, they stop diseases from spreading to people and pets.

myths.fact: It's the opposite! Their super-strong stomach acid destroys germs. They STOP diseases from spreading!
Vultures only eat animals that have already died. They're not hunters - they're recyclers!

funFact: Vultures pee on their own legs! It sounds gross, but it actually kills bacteria and keeps them cool.

name: Virginia Opossum
quickFacts: Opossums eat up to 5,000 ticks per year! They're like tiny tick-destroying machines!
When scared, opossums "play dead" - they even drool and smell bad to trick predators. Oscar-worthy acting!
Opossums are super clean! They spend tons of time grooming themselves, just like cats.
howTheyHelp: By eating SO many ticks, opossums help protect people and pets from Lyme disease!
They also eat cockroaches, snails, and slugs - all the pests we don't want around.

myths.fact: They're actually super clean AND super shy! They'd rather play dead than fight anyone.
Almost never! Opossums have a lower body temperature than most mammals, so rabies doesn't like living in them.

funFact: Opossums are North America's ONLY marsupial! That means they carry babies in a pouch, just like kangaroos!

sources.title: Cary Institute — Do Opossums Kill Ticks?

name: House Spider
quickFacts: Most house spiders couldn't hurt you even if they tried - their venom is way too weak for humans!
Spiders are amazing engineers! Some spider silk is stronger than steel of the same thickness.
You're never more than a few feet from a spider (don't worry, they're ignoring you!).
howTheyHelp: Spiders eat mosquitoes, flies, and other annoying bugs. They're like having free pest control!
Without spiders, we'd be overrun by insects. They eat BILLIONS of bugs every year worldwide.

myths.fact: Most are totally harmless! They're way more scared of you than you are of them.

myths.myth: You should squish spiders when you see them.
myths.fact: Spiders are helpers! They catch flies and mosquitoes. Maybe just move them outside instead?

funFact: Spiders can't eat solid food! They have to turn their prey into liquid before slurping it up. Weird, right?

name: Spotted Hyena
quickFacts: Plot twist: Hyenas are more closely related to CATS than dogs! Mind blown!
Hyenas have the strongest bite of almost any mammal - they can crunch through bones like we eat chips!
Girl power! Hyena clans are led by females, and the girls are bigger and stronger than the boys.
howTheyHelp: Hyenas clean up the savanna by eating leftovers from other predators. Nothing goes to waste!
They help keep other animal populations balanced - that's super important for healthy ecosystems.

myths.myth: Hyenas are cowardly scavengers who just steal food.
myths.fact: Hyenas are actually amazing hunters! They catch most of their own food - up to 95% of it!
Their powerful stomachs kill germs dead! They actually help keep nature clean.

funFact: That famous hyena "laugh" is actually a sign of excitement or nervousness - not because something's funny!

name: Brown Rat
quickFacts: Rats are SUPER smart! They can learn tricks, solve puzzles, and even giggle when they play!
Rats are caring friends - they'll share food with other rats and even help free trapped buddies!
Pet rats can learn their names and come when called, just like dogs!
howTheyHelp: Rats have helped scientists discover life-saving medicines. They're heroes of medical research!
In nature, rats spread seeds and dig holes that help plants grow. They're tiny gardeners!

myths.fact: Rats are actually super clean! They spend hours grooming themselves every day, like cats do.
With proper care, rats are safe pets! Wild rats in dirty areas can have germs, but that's about the environment, not the rats.

funFact: Rats laugh! When scientists tickle rats, they make happy ultrasonic chirps that we can't even hear!

name: Common Garter Snake
quickFacts: Most snakes are harmless! Only about 15% of snake species can hurt humans with venom.
Snakes don't have eyelids - they sleep with their eyes open! Creepy cool!
Snakes smell with their tongues! That's why they flick them in and out so much.
howTheyHelp: Snakes eat mice and rats that would otherwise eat our crops. They're farm heroes!
Without snakes, we'd have WAY more rodents everywhere. Snakes keep everything in balance.

myths.myth: All snakes are dangerous and should be killed.
myths.fact: Most snakes are harmless and helpful! Even venomous ones run away from people when they can.
Snake skin is actually dry and smooth - like leather! And they're super shy. They just want to be left alone.

funFact: Snakes can go a whole year without eating! Some big snakes only need to eat 4-5 times a year.
